Issues.Title: Vue SSR v-html on dynamic-component hydration warning
Issues.Body: ### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link _This reproduction uses NUXT for convenience, but is reproducible outside of NUXT._ [https://github.com/privatenumber/vue-ssr-vhtml-dyncomp-bug](https://github.com/privatenumber/vue-ssr-vhtml-dyncomp-bug) ### Steps to reproduce _Dynamic.vue_ ```vue ``` _App.vue_ ```vue ``` ### What is expected? The expected behavior is for there to be no hydration warning when the SSR and client markup are identical. ### What is actually happening? Although there isn't a discrepancy in rendered HTML between client and SSR, it gives warnings that there is. ![warningD](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1075694/88136132-a28f2d00-cbb6-11ea-84db-f38d0bf3adf3.png) ![warningE](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1075694/88136136-a327c380-cbb6-11ea-81e6-b3830645de60.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Vue SSR v-html on dynamic-component hydration warning" (#11532)

Issues.Title: Mutating a prop directly check lost when I mutating props on a  mutable object like Arroy or Object.
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/embed/musing-kirch-ss507?fontsize=14&hidenavigation=1&theme=dark](https://codesandbox.io/embed/musing-kirch-ss507?fontsize=14&hidenavigation=1&theme=dark)







### Steps to reproduce
When I mutating a prop directly on children component the expect behavies are give an error `[Vue warn]: Avoid mutating a prop directly since the value will be overwritten whenever the parent component re-renders. Instead, use a data or computed property based on the prop's value. Prop being mutated: "test"`, but if the prop are mutable and I change it's value and not change it's 
reference the error was lost and the `computed set handler` was lost too.


### What is expected?
Throw an error.

### What is actually happening?
No error throwed.

---
Chilren components mutating the prop and I want to cache the old value but I cannot do it, beacuse the chilren components mutatiing the prop directly and bypass the checker.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mutating a prop directly check lost when I mutating props on a  mutable object like Arroy or Object." (#11530)

Issues.Title: Dynamic Slot Names are converted to lowercase
Issues.Body:
### Version

### Steps to reproduce
Try to use the v-slot directive with a dynamic attribute that is in camelcase like: <template v-slot:[slotName]>  then slotName is converted to lowercase.

To be able to use the v-slot directive with camelcased dynamic attributes

Throws an error, that the lowercased variable is not defined on the instance but referenced during render.

Issues.Title: Slot property of data object doesn't work in a render function's createElement()
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/vigilant-diffie-shhg8?file=/src/components/Wrapper.js](https://codesandbox.io/s/vigilant-diffie-shhg8?file=/src/components/Wrapper.js)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Create 2 functional components without templates, use render functions.
2. In a Button.js create a component with slot named "icon"
3. In a Wrapper.js create a component with the Button component we created earlier, and use slot property in order to place contents of wrapper inside an "icon" slot of the button component.

### What is expected?
Contents must be rendered inside a named slot

### What is actually happening?
Contents not being displayed in a named slot

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: hydrate router-view lazy-loaded component
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/zhouxianjun/vue-prerender-test](https://github.com/zhouxianjun/vue-prerender-test)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Use vue ui to create a new vue, vue-router project
2. Add the prerender-spa-plugin plugin in vue.config.js
3. Add data-server-rendered="true" on the pre-rendering page
4. Start the serve static server in the dist directory
5. Browse pre-rendered pages

### What is expected?
Use pre-rendered static element blending

### What is actually happening?
When there is a router view in app.vue and an asynchronous component is used, the hydrate will determine that the element does not match vue, so the current element will be deleted and the element rebuilt

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5254523/87494599-016a1900-c682-11ea-986e-315691aea08e.png)

Issues.Title: Infinite recursion when deep watching structure with mounted vue component instance
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/callumgare/n5skd1tm/11/](https://jsfiddle.net/callumgare/n5skd1tm/11/)







### Steps to reproduce
See jsfiddle in minimal reproduction field. Bug can be reproduced by adding a vue component instance to a data object. Deep watching that data object then causes the recursion. 

### What is expected?
Don't traverse further if vue component instance.

### What is actually happening?
Traverse function recurses until crash.

---
I have a fix ready to submit as a pull request when/if this issue is approved.

Issues.Title: Vue log warnings to console.warn instead of console.error
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/vueschool/vuejs-components-fundamentals/commit/3a90eeace5d3f8c01b5c989bd47850a96510eb51](https://github.com/vueschool/vuejs-components-fundamentals/commit/3a90eeace5d3f8c01b5c989bd47850a96510eb51)







### Steps to reproduce
Currently, when I get a Vue "warn"ing like
```
[Vue warn]: Avoid mutating a prop directly since the value will be overwritten whenever the parent component re-renders. Instead, use a data or computed property based on the prop's value. Prop being mutated: "groupBy"

found in

---> <OpsSidebarTab> at src/components/a/b/c.vue
```

### What is expected?
The warning should go to `console.warn`

### What is actually happening?
The warning goes to `console.error`

---
To duplicate the issue, check out the link, then mutate one of the props in the example.


Currently, when I get a Vue "warn"ing like
```
[Vue warn]: Avoid mutating a prop directly since the value will be overwritten whenever the parent component re-renders. Instead, use a data or computed property based on the prop's value. Prop being mutated: "groupBy"

found in

---> <OpsSidebarTab> at src/components/a/b/c.vue
```
It actually logs it to console.error.

How can I instead make warnings log to console.warn instead?

I know I could do `Vue.config.warnHandler`, but I don't know how to get it be the same format as the regular Vue output.  For example, would I do something like

```ts
Vue.config.warnHandler = fucntion (msg, vm, trace) {
  console.warn(`[Vue warn]: ${msg}\nfound in\n--->${trace}`)
}
```
?

Are there ever other formats I have to worry about?  I wish I could just redirect these errors to `console.warn` without having to reformat them

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Vue log warnings to console.warn instead of console.error" (#11513)

Issues.Title: async event `this.` can't get the new data ,but this  can get the latest data（异步事件执行完后 无法通过this. 的方式获取data的最新数据）
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/jadepam-the-bashful/pen/XWXqXoQ](https://codepen.io/jadepam-the-bashful/pen/XWXqXoQ)







### Steps to reproduce
页面初次加载执行fn1方法，fn异步方法未执行完，重新进入页面执行fn2，fn2执行完后，更新this数据（this.$set 更新数据任然无效，直接将数据挂载在window上f1可获取最新数据）；fn1执行完，在fn1方法中无法通过`this.`获取最新的数据，但是打印出this对象时，可以看到数据已经是最新。
1、mounted do fn1，the  fn1 unfinished ，
2、mounted do fn2，the fn2 finished，update this.url
3、fn1 finished , can't get the new data by this.url，consloe.log(this)  can get the latest data

### What is expected?
f1 can get the latest data

### What is actually happening?
f1 can’t get the latest data

Issues.Title: A not operator (!) in a template breaks hot reloading
Issues.Body: ### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/drnyt/sxj18w49/7/](https://jsfiddle.net/drnyt/sxj18w49/7/) ### Steps to reproduce - NPM version 6.14.5 - vue create vue-todo ``` ``` - Adding the not operator (!) to the following line: `{{btnState ? "The button is disabled" : "The button is active"}}` to `{{!btnState ? "The button is disabled" : "The button is active"}}` works and prints button is active, but removing the not operator (!) at this point would stop hot reloading. - You can open the same link `http://localhost:8080/` in another tab without restarting and it will work again until you repeat the steps above. ### What is expected? Hot reload stays active after removing a not operator (!) from the template. ### What is actually happening? Hot reload stops working after removing the not operator (!) from the template. --- - Works fine on JSFiddle Tested on: - Google Chrome | Version 83.0.4103.116 (Official Build) (64-bit) - Microsoft Edge (Chromium) | Version 83.0.478.58 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A not operator (!) in a template breaks hot reloading" (#11504)

Issues.Title: Select Close to throw a redirect error
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?

when router has redirect I got this error: `Redirected when going from "/a" to "/b" via a navigation guard.`

I found this line of code(**199-200**):

[https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/b0ef4974aa4a8a6a4865717f1fad50954379800a/src/history/base.js#L194-L209](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/b0ef4974aa4a8a6a4865717f1fad50954379800a/src/history/base.js#L194-L209)

Redirection is a commonly used function, I think that this error should not be thrown frequently or provide a function to choose whether to throw an error.


By the way, why should this exception be thrown, and what is its purpose?

> I use Google Translate, which may cause difficulty in understanding...




### What does the proposed API look like?
```
// like this
interface NavigationGuardOptions {
  throwError: boolean
}
export type NavigationGuardNext<V extends Vue = Vue> = (
  to?: RawLocation | false | ((vm: V) => any) | void,
  options: NavigationGuardOptions
) => void
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Select Close to throw a redirect error" (#3260)

Issues.Title: ChunkLoadError: Loading chunk chunk-x failed.
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.3.2

I'm using the latest Vue versions with Vue Router, and Vue Composition API.
Since I deployed my project, I catch every few days (I guess, every deployment), a `ChunkLoadError` exception in Sentry.

I'm not sure why it happens, I don't have any custom Webpack configurations.

This is the exception:
```
ChunkLoadError: Loading chunk chunk-626fe0ff failed.
(timeout: https://example.com/js/chunk-626fe0ff.248f3eae.js)
  at (timeout: (/js/chunk-626fe0ff.248f3eae.js))
  at Function.s.e(webpack/bootstrap:126:18)
  at cb(src/pages/Inquiry.vue:67:1)
  at apply(./node_modules/@vue/composition-api/dist/vue-composition-api.module.js:932:9)
  at index(./node_modules/@vue/composition-api/dist/vue-composition-api.module.js:891:20)
  at flushQueue(./node_modules/@vue/composition-api/dist/vue-composition-api.module.js:818:15)
  at call(./node_modules/@vue/composition-api/dist/vue-composition-api.module.js:830:17)
  at i(./node_modules/vue/dist/vue.runtime.esm.js:1980:12)
  at flushCallbacks(./node_modules/vue/dist/vue.runtime.esm.js:1906:12)
```

The weird part is that the chunk file still exists, so I'm not sure what this exception is about. Any guidance, what should I check? It happens in production only, not locally. I'm using Amazon Amplify to host the app.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Vue crashes when using history.state.key as the key of <Router-view> Wrapped in <Keep-alive>
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.3.4

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/soulsands/zhykod58/3](https://jsfiddle.net/soulsands/zhykod58/3)







### Steps to reproduce
click about

### What is expected?
show the about instance and the page stay normal 

### What is actually happening?
the about instance doesn't show  and the app crashes that  it  doesn't show page again no matter which router link you click. 

---
the reason is that router.replace use the same key while the keep-alive uses the key of  a vnode to track the caches. 
when I click the About link, the key of About Vnode is the same as Home's. so the keep-alive use the cache of home to render the About vnode.
```js
// keep-alive's render method
if (cache[key]) {
          vnode.componentInstance = cache[key].componentInstance;
          // make current key freshest
          remove(keys, key);
          keys.push(key);
        } 
```
I hijacked the go\back\replace methods of router setting a flag when I use those methods and manually set a new key to Router-view. 

this strategy is quite useful, at least for me. it's quite similar to browser's bfcache. Keep-alive only hits cache when user click back or forward button of browser and use a new page otherwise.

but I still think the key should be corresponding to the change of the routes. I think it represents the identifier of a URL or a page. when you replace a page with a new page, the key should be a new key too. 

and maybe router should use a new key too when using webpack hot reloads.

looks it's compatible if the replace methord use a new key since Router just use these keys to support the scroll-behavior feature, 

By the way, I found some inconsistent behavior about the key in history when loading a page.

say the app is running at  http://localhost:8080/

-  open a new tab and fill with  http://localhost:8080/ , the key is a number. reload the page then the key is the same number
-  open a new tab and fill with  http://localhost:8080/#/ , the key is null.  reload the page then the key is null.

all above are loading a page, but the keys are totally different. 

I think it's a good idea to provide a method to get the current key Router maintained  and it's also a good idea to provide a built-in mechanism to support bfcache in vue app





<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue crashes when using history.state.key as the key of <Router-view> Wrapped in <Keep-alive>" (#3254)

Issues.Title: Fix: TypeError: Cannot read property ‘path’ of undefined on Google webcache pages
Issues.Body:
This fixes an issue where the current route (`this.$route`) is undefined.  I haven't seen it in development or production, but I noticed that when the page is being loaded from Google webcache pages, the current route is undefined and causes an infinite loop, thus preventing the page from loading properly.  I have a post with findings here:

https://forum.vuejs.org/t/typeerror-cannot-read-property-path-of-undefined/98458

Issues.Title: Navigation bug in vue-router >= 3.3.0
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.3.4 (but it exists since 3.3.0)

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/sqal/vue-router-navigation-bug](https://github.com/sqal/vue-router-navigation-bug)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Clone my repository, run `npm i && npm run serve`
2. Click on the following links

- Go to /users
- Go to /users/1

3. Go back to the previous page. At this point, you can notice that navigation is broken, because instead of users page Vue still renders the user page and clicking back again doesn't work, it still renders the last visited route.

### What is expected?
vue-router should display correct route

### What is actually happening?
To understand why this bug occurs you need to look at [this line of code](https://github.com/sqal/vue-router-navigation-bug/blob/master/src/router/index.js#L16l).  Even though I've added some comments there I'll try and explain what this code does. I added noop beforeEach hook there because I want to prevent a resolution of the initial route meaning I don't want to show dashboard or login page before the authentication check is resolved. Only after the user is authenticated (or not) I am calling `resolveRoute` function and redirecting the user to the correct page. This worked great with vue-router <= 3.2.0, but something has changed in the newer version and I can't figure out how to fix it in my code or if it has to be fixed inside a vue-router. Anyway, I would appreciate any help you could provide. Thanks

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navigation bug in vue-router >= 3.3.0" (#3245)

Issues.Title: vue-router duplicates router-view contents when using prerender-spa-plugin
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.2.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/RudolfVonKrugstein/vue-prerender-test](https://github.com/RudolfVonKrugstein/vue-prerender-test)







### Steps to reproduce
I am reporting this for vue-router, but I am not sure if it is really a problem with the vue-router component or some other tool in the toolchain I am using.

1. Check out the provided git repository, which has been created the following way
  * A new project has been created with `vue create pre-render-test` and setup with typescript and vue-router
  * Vuetify has been added using `vue add vuetify`
  * [prerender-spa-plugin](https://github.com/chrisvfritz/prerender-spa-plugin) has been added and configured (see [vue.config.js](https://github.com/RudolfVonKrugstein/vue-prerender-test/blob/master/vue.config.js))
2. Build for production using `yarn build`
3. Run a simple http server, for example like this:
    cd dist
    python3 -m http.server
4. go to localhost:8000/about

### What is expected?
The about page, just showing

```
This is an about page
```

### What is actually happening?
The about page is duplicated:

```
This is an about page
This is an about page
```

---
Looking at the DOM I can see, that not the whole app is duplicated but only the contents of `router-view`.
It also seems that some unrelated changes to the project (like adding a toolbar) makes the problem disappear, or re-appear.
Maybe it is some sort of race condition?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "vue-router duplicates router-view contents when using prerender-spa-plugin" (#3237)

Issues.Title: Slow registerModule when the module has getters
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/qaL8f36y/](https://jsfiddle.net/qaL8f36y/)







### Steps to reproduce
0. Open the link
1. Specify any number > 0 for 'getters'
2. Click Generate Modules
3. Click Generate Modules

I was unable to generate more than about 3000 getters in total before the browser crashed.

Without the link, call Store.registerModule to register 1000s of modules with a single getter (or fewer modules with more getters) to see the browser run out of resources.

You can test out creating modules without getters and notice that the time taken is more-or-less constant (~45ms for me)

### What is expected?
Registering modules with getters should perform the same as modules without getters

### What is actually happening?
Performance of Store.registerModule when the module has getters is compounding, the more getters you have the slower it is to add more modules with getters.

---
I'm using dynamic modules as a pattern to handle 'collections of objects' in the store while avoiding needing to pass the index (or object key) around in getters, mutators, etc. Similar to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44345704/separating-vuex-stores-for-dynamically-created-components - I have hundreds of objects in the store that are treated this way.

I noticed an issue when using the dev tools as the dev tools would frequently crash, and sometimes the page would too. There were repeated warning in the console `[Violation] 'setTimeout' handler took 1552ms` where the time was increasing each time, which I took to mean something wasn't linear/constant time. I finally took the time to create a minimal reproduction but found the issue was present without Vue/Vuex devtools open, though the numbers needed to crash the browser were larger without devtools.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Slow registerModule when the module has getters" (#1792)

Issues.Title: Vuex hasModule
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/hasmodule-inconsistent-with-string-x58fh?file=/src/App.vue](https://codesandbox.io/s/hasmodule-inconsistent-with-string-x58fh?file=/src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Check for the existence of a nested module with a string, vs an array path.

### What is expected?
I would expect checking with a string or an equivalent array to produce the same result.

### What is actually happening?
Checking `hasModule` with a string returns false, while checking it with an equivalent array returns true.

---
I suppose this could be intentional, but it seems like a bug.  If it's not intentional it seems like a simple fix:

Line 219 in `src/store.js ` currently is:

```if (typeof path === 'string') path = [path]```

It seems like simply changing that to the following will fix the problem:

```if (typeof path === 'string') path = path.split("/")```

Thoughts?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
